summary: Birmingham City Football Club, nicknamed "Blues," is a professional soccer team from Birmingham, England. Founded in 1875, the club has had several name changes. They play in the third-highest league in England, called EFL League One, after being relegated in 2024. Birmingham City has a rich history, winning the League Cup twice and reaching the FA Cup final in 1956. They also played in two European finals in the 1960s. The team's home is St. Andrew's @ Knighthead Park, and they have a big rivalry with nearby Aston Villa.
title: Birmingham City F.C.
